articles.author: FELIPE DANA and JIM HEINTZ
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russian forces on Friday struck the central Ukrainian city of Dnipro and pounded a key village in the southeast that Ukraine claimed to have recaptured in its grinding counteroffensive, while Moscow accused Kyiv of firing two missiles at southern Russia and wounding 20 people.
articles.title: Moscow blames Kyiv for attacks in south Russia as Kremlin forces hit Ukrainian buildings

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and HANNAH FINGERHUT
articles.description: OSKALOOSA, Iowa (AP) — Donald Trump and rival Ron DeSantis are appearing for the first time at the same Iowa presidential campaign event, both addressing a major Republican dinner Friday night as they each face critical moments that could reshape the direction of the race.
articles.title: Trump and DeSantis set to address influential Iowans at GOP dinner as candidates face pivotal moment

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell has repeatedly said he is “fine” since he froze up midsentence during a press conference on Wednesday.
articles.title: Sen. McConnell says he plans to serve his full term as leader despite questions about his health

articles.author: MEG KINNARD
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump has been indicted on three additional charges in a case that accuses him of illegally possessing classified documents at his Mar-a-Lago estate, allegations that add fresh detail to the criminal case initially issued last month.
articles.title: With Trump newly indicted, here's what to know about the documents case and what’s next

articles.author: BY SETH BORENSTEIN, CAMILLE FASSETT and MICHAEL GOLDBERG
articles.description: ROLLING FORK, Miss. (AP) — Many were not just killed at home. They were killed by their homes.Angela Eason had visited Brenda Odoms’ tidy mobile home before. It was a place where Odoms, who had many tragedies in her life, felt safe.
articles.title: How living in a mobile home makes you more likely to die in a tornado

articles.author: BY DREW COSTLEY and JOSEPH B. FREDERICK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Carlos Reyes sought shade under a tree in the Bronx on a day that felt like it was over 100 degrees (38 degrees Celsius) because of the heat and humidity.“It’s not like when you were younger, you were playing around," said the 56-year-old who runs a daycare center.
articles.title: Extreme heat moves east where many will see their hottest days of the year

articles.author: THOMAS MACHOWICZ and ANITA SNOW
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — Homeless in America's hottest big metro, Stefon James Dewitt Livengood was laid out for days inside his makeshift dwelling, struggling to breath, nauseous and vomiting.Every day this month, temperatures have soared past 110 degrees Fahrenheit (43.3 degrees Celsius).
articles.title: Homeless struggle to stay safe from record high temperatures in blistering Phoenix

articles.author: SUDHIN THANAWALA
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Authorities in Alabama said Friday they filed criminal charges against a woman who confessed to fabricating a story that she was kidnapped after stopping to check on a toddler she saw walking on the side of an interstate highway.
articles.title: Authorities charge Alabama woman who acknowledged fabricating story about kidnapping, toddler

articles.author: SAM MEDNICK
articles.description: NIAMEY, Niger (AP) — Mutinous soldiers who staged a coup in Niger declared their leader the new head of state on Friday, hours after the general asked for national and international support despite rising concerns that the political crisis could hinder the nation’s fight against jihadists and boost Russia’s influence in West Africa.
articles.title: Soldiers declare Niger general as head of state after he led a coup and detained the president

articles.author: DAVID A. LIEB
articles.description: FULTON, Mo. (AP) — At the entrance to Missouri prisons, large signs plead for help: “NOW HIRING” ... “GREAT PAY & BENEFITS."No experience is necessary. Anyone 18 and older can apply. Long hours are guaranteed.
articles.title: Mounting job vacancies push state and local governments into a wage war for workers
